definition: entire year/throughout the year/age at death

sentences.english: The spring water is of dark green, deep and running all the year round.
sentences.chinese: 泉水碧绿凝重，深不见底，终年涌流不息。

sentences.english: It is a mountain filled with snow perennially .
sentences.chinese: 它是一座常年披著面纱的山，山上的雪终年不化。

sentences.english: He tugged all the year round to feed and clothe his family.
sentences.chinese: 他终年为全家提供衣食而劳碌。

sentences.english: So, she lived a pretty short life.
sentences.chinese: 终年39岁，她的一生很短暂。

sentences.english: Black widows are solitary year-round except during this violent mating ritual.
sentences.chinese: 黑寡妇除了这一凶暴的交配过程以外终年独居。

sentences.english: This is also why greenhouses work so well and stay warm year-round. A greenhouse or solar collector
sentences.chinese: 这也是温室终年保温的秘诀。

sentences.english: Doorsill there was none, but a perennial passage for the hens under the door board.
sentences.chinese: 没有门框，门板下有一道终年群鸡乱飞的通道。

sentences.english: Automatic thermostat control makes all-year-round automatic operation possible;
sentences.chinese: 自动恒温控制，可终年全自动运行。

sentences.english: Snow is absent in some countries.
So why is Rasheed still lingering in jail, five years later?
sentences.chinese: 但5年之后，拉希德仍旧在监牢中枯坐终年。

sentences.english: Dies of Yuquan River singing difficult songs throughout the year.
sentences.chinese: 郁郁的玉泉河终年唱着难懂的歌。

sentences.english: Britain's weather is the oceanity temperate zone foliage forest climate, all year long temperate moist.
sentences.chinese: 英国的天气属海洋性温带阔叶林气候，终年温和湿润。

sentences.english: The plunging water also sends out a never-ending roar as it strikes the bottom.
sentences.chinese: 飞流直下的河水撞击谷底，也发出终年不息的轰鸣声。

sentences.english: The old tyrant was dead of a heart attack at sixty five.
sentences.chinese: 老伯爵死于心脏病发作，终年六十五岁。

sentences.english: In fact, there is not a peak roosting time. The birds roost all year.
sentences.chinese: 实际上，并没有栖息高峰这一回事，鸟儿终年栖息。

sentences.english: Sonia died in his sleep 20, aged 87 years.
sentences.chinese: 索尼娅20日在睡梦中去世，终年87岁。

definition: all year round/for years on end/average year
to accumulate work causes sickness (idiom); to fall ill from constant overwork
to die/to depart this life (euphemism)/same as 去世
evergreen pine and cypress (idiom); steadfast nobility
